ext_descriptions.ext_description: The activity_as_realized UoF specifies the information needed to record the historical occurrence of an activity. The following application objects are defined

ext_description.p: An activity_actual records the occurrence of an activity. The activity_actual is related through an activity_happening to the activity for which it is an occurance.
The existence of an activity_actual instance means that the activity_actual has started.
ext_description.note: A date or date_and_time should be assigned to the activity_actual with the role "start_date" to record when the activity started.

A date or date_and_time may be assigned to the activity with role "end_date" to record when the activity finished. In general, the absence of this assignment cannot be used to infer that the activity is continuing, only that the end of the activity has not yet been recorded.
A more fine grained history of the progress of an activity may be recorded by applying a state to the activity, but the of this must be defined through local business rules.

Information relating to the use and consumption of resources, to activity outputs, and to the consequences of an activity (such as additional work_requests) may also be associated with an activity_actual. In that case, the associated data would be interpreted as an historical record of what occurred.

The subtyping approach used ensures compatibility with existing ISO 10303 definitions, however activity and activity_actual should be regarded as mutually exclusive. Further, subtyping of activity_actual to executed_action or directed_action is incompatible with the semantics of activity_actual.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: An activity_happening is a relationship between the definition of an activity (activity_happening.predicted) and its actual occurrence (activity_happening.actual). The ordinary value for activity.name may be "actual", though this is redundant. Many activity_actuals may be the actual for a single activity, for example, where a single defined activity is recorded historically by several sub-activities. A single activity_actual may fulfil several activities, for example, where a single servicing activity takes the opportunity to make additional checks and repairs.
The activity which is the record of the historical occurance.
The activity as defined in advance of its historical occurance.
